item.title: Puddle of water where old paving meets new. Rain not draing away., 14th November
item.description:

item.title: Bus hit a lamppost, 14th November
item.description:
Reporting bus has collided into lamppost & now at an angle. No exposed wires. Lamppost number: H7042. Opposite British Heart Foundation, High Street, Bromley, BR1 1NN. Fire brigade onsite now moving the bus. Police cad: 31 (14/11/25)

item.title: Hampstead road, 14th November
item.description:
Hampstead Road (A400) regularly suffers long delays and queues, particularly around the Robert Street junction. Temporary signals/works are causing vehicles to block side roads and pedestrian crossings, creating dangerous conditions for pedestrians and cyclists and delaying emergency vehicles. Please investigate signal timing, consider traffic-calming or stewarding, or just get a move on with the work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Road, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, Victoria Way, 14th November
item.description:
Charlton Triangle Homes stopped locking its bin stores long ago, so its residents use this area as a spot to dump furniture. Shouldn’t the council take action against Charlton Triangle/Peabody?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Way, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown shrub on Tunnel Road blocking parking space, 14th November
item.description:
There is a vine tree/plant growing on Tunnel Road on the side of the Sands Film Studio building which has overgrown and now obstructing a parking space. The branches are long and scratching the side and roof of cars trying to park in the space. The branches have grown considerably in the past 4 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121-145, Hatteraick Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slippery Leaves Derwent Road Se20, 13th November
item.description:
Dangerous slippery leaves on Road The whole Road needs cleaning / sweeping manually . It is far too many leaves for a machine to pick up, but also the machine cannot get into the grooves of the twist and turn in the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous slippery Road,, 13th November
item.description:
All of Derwin Road is covered in leaves. They are wet and slippery and need cleanup. The road is not been cleaned for months. This is the last road in the borough and is always left out. There is so many piles of leaves that that it is stopping residents from being able to park. The reason I ask for the road is sweat manually is there is many pavement extensions is supposed to slow the traffic down and the road grooves in and out and the machine cannot get into the grooves. It seems that the machines just push all the leaves to one area and when it hits a groove, it doesn’t pick them up so it’s best to say the old-fashioned way a person and a broom will be perfect for the job. The leaves are very slippery and as mentioned earlier at so many piles are in the road. Could you please arrange for somebody to come and sweep the road manually and by doing it manually they will be able to get into the gutters where a lot of the leaves are….. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All Street Lights both sides kings Highway out, 13th November
item.description:
From Kingsdale Road to junction of Wickham Street all Street lights are out apart from 3 One outside 56 Kings Highway One by traffic lights by Wicks And one opposite Wickes by houses It's very dark along Kings Highway
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kings Highway, Plumstead

item.title: Drains need cleaning in Netherlands Road near Oakleigh Park Station, 13th November
item.description:
Monday 10th November 2025. Walked along Netherlands Rd from Temple Ave to Oakleigh Park station. Only the central third of the carriageway was above water because all the drains were blocked. Every car that passed sent a wall of water over the pavement and over any pedestrians on it as there is no way of escape. We were soaked and the water was dripping off us and our shoes were full of water. These drains are frequently blocked. Either they are insufficient in number or they need clearing out more often. Ironically two to three weekends beforehand the drains in Temple Ave had been cleared as they are inaccessible on weekdays due to parked cars. There is no such reason for not clearing the drains in Netherlands Rd.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Netherlands Road, East Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road lines, 13th November
item.description:

item.title: Nuisance Leaf-Blower at Fairchilds Garden, 13th November
item.description:
On weekends, before 9 am, the leaf blowers at Fairchild’s Gardens run for a long period of time. This is loud, disruptive, and unnecessary for such a small park and so early in the day.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Waterson Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 outside number 179 (just north of Lovelace Rd junction) is a zebra crossing. Central island Keep Left board graffiti tagged – rear black plastic surface. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovelace Road, Tulse Hill, London
